definition: Defense aircrafts such as fighter jets, helicopters, and UAVs.

system_types_specific.name: Fighter
system_types_specific.definition: Combat aircraft designed for air-to-air combat. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** F-35 Lightning II, F-16, F-22, F-15EX, F/A-18.

system_types_specific.name: Transport Aircraft
system_types_specific.definition: Aircraft designed for transporting troops, weapons, and other military equipment. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** C-130 Hercules, C-17 Globemaster III, A400M Atlas, C-27J Spartan, C-295.

system_types_specific.name: Trainers
system_types_specific.definition: Aircraft designed for flight training of pilots and aircrew. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** T-7A Red Hawk, T-6 Texan II, Pilatus PC-21, Hawk, M-346 Master.

system_types_specific.name: Tanker
system_types_specific.definition: Aircraft designed for aerial refueling of other aircraft. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** KC-46 Pegasus, KC-135 Stratotanker, A330 MRTT, KC-130J.

system_types_specific.name: Maritime Aircraft
system_types_specific.definition: Aircraft designed for maritime patrol, anti-submarine warfare, and anti-surface warfare. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** P-8 Poseidon, P-3 Orion, ATR 72 MP, C-295 MPA.

system_types_specific.name: C4ISR
system_types_specific.definition: Aircraft designed for Command, Control, Communications, Computers, Intelligence, Surveillance, and Reconnaissance. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** E-3 Sentry (AWACS), E-2 Hawkeye, RC-135 Rivet Joint, Global 6000 (modified).

system_types_specific.name: Fixed Wing Other
system_types_specific.definition: Other fixed-wing aircraft not covered by the main categories. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** Gliders, Experimental aircraft, Special mission aircraft not fitting other categories.

system_types_specific.name: Bomber
system_types_specific.definition: Strategic aircraft designed to drop large amounts of ordnance on ground targets. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** B-2 Spirit, B-52 Stratofortress, B-21 Raider, Tu-160.

system_types_specific.name: Light Combat Aircraft
system_types_specific.definition: Lightweight, multi-role fighter aircraft often used for advanced training or light attack missions. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** FA-50, Tejas, JF-17.

system_types_specific.name: Gunship
system_types_specific.definition: Heavily armed aircraft designed for air-to-ground attacks and close air support. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** AC-130J Ghostrider.

system_types_specific.name: ISR-Strike
system_types_specific.definition: Aircraft capable of conducting both intelligence gathering and precision strike missions. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** Armed turboprops like AT-802U, Archangel.

system_types_specific.name: AEW&C
system_types_specific.definition: Airborne Early Warning and Control system aircraft designed to detect aircraft, ships, and vehicles at long ranges. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** E-7 Wedgetail, Saab GlobalEye.

system_types_specific.name: Target Drone
system_types_specific.definition: Unmanned aerial vehicles used as targets for training air defense crews and testing weapon systems. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** BQM-167, QF-16.

system_types_specific.name: Not Applicable
system_types_specific.definition: Category not applicable for the specific context.

system_types_specific.name: Attack Helicopter
system_types_specific.definition: Helicopters designed for attacking ground targets. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** AH-64 Apache, AH-1Z Viper, Eurocopter Tiger, Mi-24 Hind, Ka-52 Alligator.

system_types_specific.name: Transport Helicopter
system_types_specific.definition: Helicopters designed for transporting troops and cargo. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** CH-47 Chinook, CH-53K King Stallion, UH-60 Black Hawk, Mi-17, NH90.

system_types_specific.name: Utility Helicopter
system_types_specific.definition: Helicopters designed for general-purpose utility roles. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** UH-1Y Venom, H145M, AW139, Bell 412.

system_types_specific.name: Maritime Helicopter
system_types_specific.definition: Helicopters designed for naval operations. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** MH-60R Seahawk, NH90 NFH, AW159 Wildcat, Merlin HM2.

system_types_specific.name: Scout Helicopter
system_types_specific.definition: Helicopters designed for reconnaissance and observation. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** OH-58 Kiowa, Bell 407, MD 530.

system_types_specific.name: Rotary Wing Other
system_types_specific.definition: Other rotary-wing aircraft. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** Autogyros, experimental rotary platforms.

system_types_specific.name: Rotary Wing Attack
system_types_specific.definition: Synonymous with Attack Helicopter; focused on anti-armor and ground support missions.

system_types_specific.name: Rotary Wing Maritime
system_types_specific.definition: Synonymous with Maritime Helicopter; focused on ASW/ASuW missions.

system_types_specific.name: Rotary Wing Scout
system_types_specific.definition: Synonymous with Scout Helicopter; focused on reconnaissance.

system_types_specific.name: Rotary Wing Transport
system_types_specific.definition: Synonymous with Transport Helicopter; focused on logistics and troop movement.

system_types_specific.name: Not Applicable
system_types_specific.definition: Category not applicable for the specific context.

system_types_specific.name: MALE UAV
system_types_specific.definition: Medium-Altitude Long-Endurance UAV. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** MQ-9 Reaper, MQ-1 Predator, Bayraktar TB2, Heron TP.

system_types_specific.name: HALE UAV
system_types_specific.definition: High-Altitude Long-Endurance UAV. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** RQ-4 Global Hawk, MQ-4C Triton.

system_types_specific.name: Tactical UAV
system_types_specific.definition: UAVs designed for tactical surveillance and reconnaissance. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** RQ-7 Shadow, ScanEagle, Blackjack.

system_types_specific.name: Mini/Micro UAV
system_types_specific.definition: Small UAVs used for close-range surveillance. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** Raven, Puma, Black Hornet.

system_types_specific.name: UCAV
system_types_specific.definition: Unmanned Combat Aerial Vehicle. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** X-47B, nEUROn, Taranis, Okhotnik.

system_types_specific.name: Loitering Munition
system_types_specific.definition: Munitions that loiter over a target area before attacking. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** Switchblade, Harop, Hero series.

system_types_specific.name: UAV Other
system_types_specific.definition: Other types of UAVs. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** Target drones, cargo UAVs.

system_types_specific.name: Not Applicable
system_types_specific.definition: Category not applicable for the specific context.

system_types_general.name: Other Lift Types
system_types_general.definition: Other types of aerial lift platforms.

system_types_specific.name: Lighter-than-Air
system_types_specific.definition: Aircraft that float in the air (e.g., blimps, aerostats). **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** JLENS, Tethered Aerostat Radar System.

system_types_specific.name: Spaceplane
system_types_specific.definition: Vehicles that operate in space but land like aircraft. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** X-37B.

system_types_specific.name: Hybrid
system_types_specific.definition: Aircraft combining features of fixed-wing and rotary-wing flight. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** V-22 Osprey, V-280 Valor (Tiltrotors).

system_types_specific.name: Airship
system_types_specific.definition: Powered lighter-than-air aircraft capable of being steered. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** Hybrid Air Vehicles Airlander.

system_types_specific.name: Parafoil
system_types_specific.definition: Non-rigid textile wing with an aerodynamic cell structure, inflated by the wind. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** Precision guided cargo delivery systems.

system_types_specific.name: Not Applicable
system_types_specific.definition: Category not applicable for the specific context.

system_types_specific.name: Not Applicable
system_types_specific.definition: Category not applicable.

system_types_specific.name: Main Battle Tank
system_types_specific.definition: Heavily armored and armed combat vehicles. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** M1 Abrams, Leopard 2, Challenger 2, T-90, Merkava.

system_types_specific.name: Infantry Fighting Vehicle
system_types_specific.definition: Armored vehicles designed to transport infantry into battle and provide fire support. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** M2 Bradley, Puma, CV90, BMP-3.

system_types_specific.name: Armoured Personnel Carrier
system_types_specific.definition: Armored vehicles designed to transport personnel. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** M113, Stryker (ICV variant), Boxer, Patria AMV.

system_types_specific.name: Armoured Reconnaissance Vehicle
system_types_specific.definition: Armored vehicles designed for reconnaissance. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** Ajax, Fennek, CRV.

system_types_specific.name: Mine Protected Vehicle
system_types_specific.definition: Vehicles designed to withstand landmine and IED attacks (MRAP). **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** Cougar, MaxxPro, Bushmaster.

system_types_specific.name: Armoured All-Terrain Vehicle
system_types_specific.definition: Highly mobile armored vehicles designed for difficult terrain (snow, swamp). **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** BvS10 Viking, Bronco.

system_types_specific.name: Armoured Utility/Protected Patrol Vehicles
system_types_specific.definition: Lightly armored vehicles for patrol, liaison, and utility roles. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** L-ATV, Eagle V, LMV.

system_types_specific.name: Tracked Armoured Fighting Vehicles
system_types_specific.definition: Generic category for AFVs that move on continuous tracks.

system_types_specific.name: Wheeled Armoured Fighting Vehicles
system_types_specific.definition: Generic category for AFVs that move on wheels.

system_types_specific.name: AFV Other
system_types_specific.definition: Other armored fighting vehicles. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** Tank destroyers, combat engineering vehicles (if armored).

system_types_specific.name: Not Applicable
system_types_specific.definition: Category not applicable for the specific context.

system_types_specific.name: Self-Propelled Artillery
system_types_specific.definition: Artillery equipped with its own propulsion system. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** M109 Paladin, PzH 2000, K9 Thunder, Archer.

system_types_specific.name: Towed Artillery
system_types_specific.definition: Artillery that is towed by another vehicle. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** M777, L118 Light Gun.

system_types_specific.name: Multiple Rocket Launcher
system_types_specific.definition: Rocket artillery systems. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** M142 HIMARS, M270 MLRS, BM-21 Grad.

system_types_specific.name: Mortar
system_types_specific.definition: Muzzle-loading indirect fire weapon. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** M120, M224.

system_types_specific.name: Artillery Other
system_types_specific.definition: Other types of artillery. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** Coastal artillery, anti-aircraft guns.

system_types_specific.name: Other
system_types_specific.definition: General category for artillery not fitting specific definitions.

system_types_specific.name: Not Applicable
system_types_specific.definition: Category not applicable for the specific context.

system_types_specific.name: Light Utility Vehicle
system_types_specific.definition: Lightweight vehicles for general utility. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** HMMWV (Humvee), JLTV, G-Wagon.

system_types_specific.name: Truck
system_types_specific.definition: Military trucks for transport and logistics. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** FMTV, HEMTT, MAN HX series.

system_types_specific.name: Tactical Vehicle Other
system_types_specific.definition: Other tactical vehicles. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** All-terrain vehicles (ATVs), motorcycles.

system_types_specific.name: Not Applicable
system_types_specific.definition: Category not applicable for the specific context.

system_types_general.name: Logistics & Support
system_types_general.definition: Vehicles and equipment for logistics and support.

system_types_specific.name: Engineering Vehicle
system_types_specific.definition: Vehicles designed for construction and demolition tasks. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** M9 ACE, ABV, Bridge layers.

system_types_specific.name: Recovery Vehicle
system_types_specific.definition: Vehicles designed to recover other vehicles. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** M88 Hercules, Buffalo.

system_types_specific.name: All-Terrain Vehicles
system_types_specific.definition: Small, open motorized buggies or quad bikes for off-road mobility. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** MRZR, Sportsman.

system_types_specific.name: Combat Engineering Vehicles
system_types_specific.definition: Heavily armored vehicles used for combat engineering tasks like obstacle breaching. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** Trojan, Terrier.

system_types_specific.name: Construction Vehicles
system_types_specific.definition: Standard heavy plant equipment (excavators, dozers) militarized for engineering support.

system_types_specific.name: Engineering Equipment
system_types_specific.definition: Specialized equipment for engineering tasks (e.g., mine plows, rollers).

system_types_specific.name: Light Tactical/Utility Vehicles
system_types_specific.definition: Light vehicles for transport and utility, bridging the gap between LUVs and trucks.

system_types_specific.name: Logistics Support Other
system_types_specific.definition: Other logistics and support vehicles. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** Ambulances, command posts, fuel tankers.

system_types_specific.name: Not Applicable
system_types_specific.definition: Category not applicable for the specific context.

system_types_general.name: Unmanned Ground Vehicles
system_types_general.definition: Vehicles that operate on the ground without an onboard human presence.

system_types_specific.name: Combat UGV
system_types_specific.definition: UGVs designed for combat. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** Ripsaw, Uran-9.

system_types_specific.name: ISR UGV
system_types_specific.definition: UGVs designed for intelligence, surveillance, and reconnaissance. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** PackBot, Talon.

system_types_specific.name: Logistics UGV
system_types_specific.definition: UGVs designed for logistics and transport. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** SMET, MUTT.

system_types_specific.name: EOD UGV
system_types_specific.definition: UGVs designed for explosive ordnance disposal. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** Andros.

system_types_specific.name: UGV Other
system_types_specific.definition: Other types of UGVs.

system_types_specific.name: Not Applicable
system_types_specific.definition: Category not applicable for the specific context.

system_types_general.name: Other Land
system_types_general.definition: Land systems not covered in other categories.

system_types_specific.name: Soldier Fighting Systems
system_types_specific.definition: Integrated equipment systems worn or carried by soldiers to enhance combat effectiveness. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** Future Soldier programs, exoskeletons.

system_types_specific.name: Other
system_types_specific.definition: Miscellaneous land systems.

system_types_general.name: Rolling Stock
system_types_general.definition: Railway vehicles used for military logistics.

system_types_specific.name: Not Applicable
system_types_specific.definition: Category not applicable.

system_types_specific.name: Not Applicable
system_types_specific.definition: Category not applicable.

definition: Defense vessels such as submarines, aircraft carriers, and destroyers.

system_types_specific.name: Ballistic Missile Submarine
system_types_specific.definition: Submarines designed to launch ballistic missiles (SSBN). **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** Ohio class, Columbia class, Vanguard class, Borei class.

system_types_specific.name: Attack Submarine
system_types_specific.definition: Submarines designed to attack other submarines and ships (SSN/SSK). **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** Virginia class, Astute class, Los Angeles class, Type 212.

system_types_specific.name: Cruise Missile Submarine
system_types_specific.definition: Submarines designed to launch cruise missiles (SSGN). **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** Oscar class, Ohio class (converted).

system_types_specific.name: Midget Submarine
system_types_specific.definition: Small submarines used for special operations. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** SDV.

system_types_specific.name: Diesel-Powered Submarine
system_types_specific.definition: Submarines propelled by diesel-electric engines, typically SSKs.

system_types_specific.name: Nuclear-Powered Submarine
system_types_specific.definition: Submarines propelled by nuclear reactors, typically SSNs or SSBNs.

system_types_specific.name: Sub-Surface Other
system_types_specific.definition: Other sub-surface vessels. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** Research submarines, rescue submarines.

system_types_specific.name: Other
system_types_specific.definition: Miscellaneous sub-surface vessels.

system_types_specific.name: Not Applicable
system_types_specific.definition: Category not applicable for the specific context.

system_types_general.name: Surface Combatants
system_types_general.definition: Ships designed for warfare on the surface of the water.

system_types_specific.name: Aircraft Carrier
system_types_specific.definition: Warships designed to deploy and recover aircraft. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** Ford class, Nimitz class, Queen Elizabeth class.

system_types_specific.name: Destroyer
system_types_specific.definition: Fast, maneuverable warships with long-endurance. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** Arleigh Burke class, Zumwalt class, Type 45.

system_types_specific.name: Frigate
system_types_specific.definition: Warships smaller than destroyers, used for protection of other ships. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** FREMM, Type 26, FFG(X).

system_types_specific.name: Corvette
system_types_specific.definition: Small warships smaller than frigates. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** Visby class, Sa'ar 5 class.

system_types_specific.name: Cruiser
system_types_specific.definition: Large warships capable of multiple roles. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** Ticonderoga class.

system_types_specific.name: Surface Combatant Other
system_types_specific.definition: Other surface combatants. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** Littoral Combat Ships (LCS).

system_types_specific.name: Cruisers
system_types_specific.definition: Synonymous with Cruiser category.

system_types_specific.name: Destroyers
system_types_specific.definition: Synonymous with Destroyer category.

system_types_specific.name: Frigates
system_types_specific.definition: Synonymous with Frigate category.

system_types_specific.name: Other Surface Combatants
system_types_specific.definition: Synonymous with Surface Combatant Other.

system_types_specific.name: Not Applicable
system_types_specific.definition: Category not applicable for the specific context.

system_types_general.name: Amphibious
system_types_general.definition: Ships designed to support amphibious operations.

system_types_specific.name: Amphibious Assault Ship
system_types_specific.definition: Ships designed to deploy ground forces on enemy shores, often with flight decks. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** Wasp class, America class, Mistral class.

system_types_specific.name: Landing Platform Dock
system_types_specific.definition: Amphibious warfare ships with a well deck to launch landing craft. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** San Antonio class.

system_types_specific.name: Landing Craft
system_types_specific.definition: Small boats or barges used to convey a landing force from sea to shore. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** LCU, LCAC.

system_types_specific.name: Amphibious Other
system_types_specific.definition: Other amphibious ships. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** LST (Landing Ship Tank).

system_types_specific.name: Other
system_types_specific.definition: Miscellaneous amphibious vessels.

system_types_specific.name: Not Applicable
system_types_specific.definition: Category not applicable for the specific context.

system_types_general.name: Patrol and Costal Combatants
system_types_general.definition: Smaller vessels for patrol and coastal defense.

system_types_specific.name: Patrol Vessel
system_types_specific.definition: Ships designed for coastal defense and patrol. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** OPV, IPV.

system_types_specific.name: Fast Attack Craft
system_types_specific.definition: Small, fast vessels armed with missiles or guns. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** Missile boats.

system_types_specific.name: Patrol Boat/Craft - Coastal
system_types_specific.definition: Small vessels used for patrolling coastal waters.

system_types_specific.name: Patrol Boat/Craft - Ocean
system_types_specific.definition: Larger patrol vessels capable of operating in open ocean (OPVs).

system_types_specific.name: Patrol Boat/Craft - Riverine
system_types_specific.definition: Small patrol boats designed for river and shallow water operations.

system_types_specific.definition: Ships designed to supply other ships with fuel, food, and ammunition. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** Tankers, supply ships.

system_types_specific.name: Transport Ship
system_types_specific.definition: Ships designed to transport troops and equipment.

system_types_specific.name: Auxiliary Other
system_types_specific.definition: Other auxiliary ships. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** Hospital ships, tugs, research ships.

system_types_specific.name: Electronic Support
system_types_specific.definition: Systems for detecting and analyzing electronic signals. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** RWR, ESM.

system_types_specific.name: Electronic Protection
system_types_specific.definition: Systems for protecting against EW. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** Flares, Chaff (though often considered countermeasures).

system_types_specific.name: Air-to-Air Missile
system_types_specific.definition: Missiles launched from aircraft against other aircraft. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** AIM-120 AMRAAM, AIM-9 Sidewinder, Meteor.

system_types_specific.name: Air-to-Surface Missile
system_types_specific.definition: Missiles launched from aircraft against ground/sea targets. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** AGM-114 Hellfire, AGM-65 Maverick, Storm Shadow.

system_types_specific.name: Surface-to-Air Missile
system_types_specific.definition: Missiles launched from the ground/sea against aircraft. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** Patriot, S-400, SM-2, SM-6.

system_types_specific.name: Surface-to-Surface Missile
system_types_specific.definition: Missiles launched from the ground/sea against ground/sea targets. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** MGM-140 ATACMS, Tomahawk, NSM.

system_types_specific.name: Anti-Tank Guided Missile
system_types_specific.definition: Missiles designed to destroy tanks. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** Javelin, TOW, Spike.

system_types_specific.name: Ballistic Missile
system_types_specific.definition: Missiles that follow a ballistic trajectory. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** Minuteman III, Trident II.

system_types_specific.name: Cruise Missile
system_types_specific.definition: Missiles that fly at low altitude and high speed. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** Tomahawk, JASSM.

system_types_specific.name: Anti-Radiation
system_types_specific.definition: Missiles designed to detect and destroy radio emission sources (radars). **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** HARM, AARGM.

system_types_specific.name: Anti-Ship
system_types_specific.definition: Missiles designed to destroy surface ships. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** Harpoon, Exocet.

system_types_specific.name: Anti-Submarine
system_types_specific.definition: Missiles designed to deliver a torpedo or depth charge against submarines. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** ASROC.

system_types_specific.name: Anti-Tank
system_types_specific.definition: Synonymous with Anti-Tank Guided Missile.

system_types_specific.name: Missile Other
system_types_specific.definition: Other types of missiles.

system_types_specific.name: Other
system_types_specific.definition: Miscellaneous missile systems.

system_types_specific.name: Not Applicable
system_types_specific.definition: Category not applicable for the specific context.

system_types_specific.name: Small Arms Ammunition
system_types_specific.definition: Ammunition for small arms. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** 5.56mm, 7.62mm, .50 BMG.

system_types_specific.name: Medium Caliber Ammunition
system_types_specific.definition: Ammunition for autocannons. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** 20mm, 25mm, 30mm.

system_types_specific.name: Large Caliber Ammunition
system_types_specific.definition: Ammunition for tanks and artillery. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** 105mm, 120mm, 155mm.

system_types_specific.name: Bomb
system_types_specific.definition: Explosive weapons dropped from aircraft. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** JDAM, Paveway, Mk 82.

system_types_specific.name: Rocket
system_types_specific.definition: Unguided propelled weapons. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** Hydra 70, Zuni.

system_types_specific.name: Munition Other
system_types_specific.definition: Other munitions. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** Grenades, mines, demolition charges.

system_types_specific.definition: Weapons served by a crew. **MATCHING EXAMPLES:** Heavy machine guns, automatic grenade launchers.
